data.title: Just a bar
data.text: The food was fine, but it is not a restaurant by any means.  It is a bar that has a menu.  Food takes a long time to arrive and the clientele are locals coming for their cheap beer and apps.  We wouldn't return.

data.title: Great alternative to the Sheraton next door
data.text: I was staying at the Sheraton next door for four nights, and this neighborhood local place was a welcome respite for lunch one day and drinks on two of the nights. While it's nothing out of the ordinary,it has excellent bar food and the drink/food prices are very fair (and considerably less than at the Sheraton).

data.title: quick bite
data.text: sports bar, friendly staff, food was good.  Place needs a remodel but fine if you're a red sox fan! Waitress was funny and the beer was ice cold.

data.title: Sports baaaar with a twist.
data.text: They have great pub food in this place. Its a locals place for sure but thats what I like best. If the locals go there, eat there, spend there, and its not a franchise, then thats where i wanna go. Thin crust pizza and well priced I'm in. Great steak and cheese sub and the drinks were well poured and a bargain under $6 for vodka soda.Sports on and tons of TV's with great bar service, i would say its a must see if your staying in the area or attending an event.

data.title: Great Sports Bar filled with Die-Hards
data.text:
My date and I watched the Patriots game here one night and the crowd was both raucous (at the appropriate times,) and very friendly.

It is not far from the Sheraton, on Springfield's attractive Main Street, and I would recommend it for anyone who wants to catch a game.

P.S. There are A LOT of TVs at this bar, so - if for example, you are a Tampa Bay Buccaneers fan -- they'll help you out. :)

data.title: Great pub
data.text: We poped in a couple of times for drinks and it was great.  Good slection of beer and lots of sports to watch on the TVs.  Great service.  Would go to again.
